title: Dynamic Science Education System Design: Learner and Knowledge-Centered Inquiry Process

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level scientific experiment design and data analysis experience, basic understanding of scientific inquiry methods required
context.additional_context: Learners are community members interested in designing science education content and using digital tools. Provided with digital devices (tablets/laptops), they combine online platforms and offline workshops to strengthen scientific observation and experimentation.

learning_goals: Learners understand dynamic educational system design principles and can contextually integrate learner-centered and knowledge-centered instructional methods based on the scientific inquiry process.

Learners develop the ability to systematically analyze experimental data and hypotheses using various digital communication tools (quiz platforms, collaborative boards, etc.) when designing science education content.
Learners can enhance the flexibility of the curriculum using formative assessment tools and propose methods to provide real-time feedback considering scientific variables.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
